The flood hazard zone classification describes the level and type of flood risk assigned to the location based on FEMA floodplain mapping.
The indicator of Special Flood Hazard Area status describes whether the location is subject to a 1-percent-annual-chance (100-year) flood hazard.

The base flood elevation represents the estimated water surface height reached during a 1-percent-annual-chance (100-year) flood event, providing a quantitative measure of flood depth and hydraulic demand at the location.
The flood zone subtype provides a more specific categorical description of flood hazard conditions within the mapped flood zone, such as minimal, shallow, or coastal risk.
